verses.text: 有一個法利賽人，名叫尼哥德慕，是猶太人的官長。

words.note: People from the region of Judea.

verses.text: 他夜間來到耶穌那裡，對他說：「拉比，我們知道你是從 神那裡來的教師，因為如果沒有 神同在，你所行的這些神蹟，就沒有人能行。」

words.note: A Jewish title for a teacher or master.
The leading space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
The leading space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to God's accompanying presence.
Used to form a nominalized phrase, indicating what is done.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「我實實在在告訴你，人若不重生，就不能見 神的國。」

words.note: Emphatic reduplication, translates 'Amen, amen' or 'Truly, truly'.
A key theological concept of spiritual renewal.
Contextually 'see' implies 'enter' or 'experience'.
The leading space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.

verses.text: 尼哥德慕說：「人老了，怎能重生呢？難道他能再進母腹生出來嗎？」

words.note: Indicates a change of state or completed action.
A key theological concept of spiritual renewal.
Used to express rhetorical or incredulous questions.
Directional complement indicating movement outwards.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「我實實在在告訴你，人若不是從水和聖靈生的，就不能進 神的國。

words.note: Emphatic reduplication, translates 'Amen, amen' or 'Truly, truly'.
Refers to the Third Person of the Trinity.
The leading space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to the Kingdom of God/Heaven.

verses.text: 從肉身生的就是肉身，從靈生的就是靈。

words.note: Refers to the physical, earthly nature.
Refers to the physical, earthly nature.
Refers to the spiritual nature, often implying the Holy Spirit.
Refers to the spiritual nature, often implying the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: 你不要因為我對你說『你們必須重生』而感到希奇。

words.note: A key theological concept in Christianity.
Connects clauses, often showing consequence or transition.
Often used in biblical texts for 'to marvel' or 'to wonder'.

verses.text: 風隨意而吹，你聽見它的響聲，卻不知道它從哪裡來，往哪裡去；凡從聖靈生的，也是這樣。」

words.note: Connects verb phrases.
Often used in formal or literary contexts, including scripture.
Refers to the third person of the Trinity.

verses.text: 尼哥德慕說：「怎能有這事呢？」

words.note: Short for 怎麼 (zěnme).

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你是以色列人的教師，還不明白這事嗎？
我實實在在告訴你，我們知道的，才講論；見過的，就作證，然而你們卻不接受我們的見證。

words.note: A reduplicated adverbial phrase emphasizing truth.

verses.text: 我對你們講地上的事，你們尚且不信，如果講天上的事，怎能相信呢？
除了那從天上降下來的人子（有些抄本作「除了那從天上降下來仍舊在天上的人子」），沒有人升過天。
摩西在曠野怎樣把銅蛇舉起，人子也必照樣被舉起來，
使所有信他的人都得永生。
「 神愛世人，甚至把他的獨生子賜給他們，叫一切信他的，不至滅亡，反得永生。

words.note: The leading space in the Chinese text is a reverence marker.
Refers to Jesus Christ.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase.

words.definition: not to the extent of, lest

verses.text: 因為 神差他的兒子到世上來，不是要定世人的罪，而是要使世人藉著他得救。

words.note: The leading space in the Chinese text is a reverence marker.

verses.text: 信他的，不被定罪；不信的，罪已經定了，因為他不信 神獨生子的名。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase.
The leading space in the Chinese text is a reverence marker.
Refers to Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 光來到世上，世人因為自己的行為邪惡，不愛光倒愛黑暗，定他們罪的原因，就在這裡。

words.note: In this context, often refers to Christ or divine truth.
In this context, often refers to Christ or divine truth.

verses.text: 凡作惡的都恨光，不來接近光，免得他的惡行暴露出來。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from preceding verb/phrase.
In this context, often refers to Christ or divine truth.
In this context, often refers to Christ or divine truth.
Directional verb complement.

verses.text: 凡行真理的，就來接近光，好顯明他所作的都是靠著 神而作的。」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase referring to 'that which is done'
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: ，我必衰微這事以後，耶穌和門徒來到猶太地，他和他們住在那裡，並且施洗。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower'; a common term for students/disciples
A verb-object compound, 'perform baptism'.

verses.heading: Further Testimony About Jesus by John the Baptist

verses.text: 約翰也在靠近撒冷的艾嫩施洗，因為那裡水多；眾人都去受洗。

words.note: A verb-object compound, 'perform baptism'.
A verb-object compound, 'receive baptism'.

verses.text: 那時約翰還沒有入獄。

words.note: A verb-object compound, 'enter prison'.

verses.text: 約翰的門徒和一個猶太人為潔淨禮發生辯論。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower'; a common term for students/disciples
Refers to Jewish purification rituals.

verses.text: 他們來到約翰那裡，對他說：「拉比，你看，從前和你在約旦河東，你為他作見證的那一位，他也在施洗，眾人都到他那裡去了。」

words.note: Lit. 'make to see evidence'.
Used to respectfully refer to a person.
Indicates an action in progress.
Lit. 'bestow washing'.

verses.text: 約翰回答：「除了從天上賜下來給他的，人就不能得到甚麼。

words.note: Often used for divine gifts.
Used as a directional complement here.
Used in questions or with negatives (e.g., 'not anything').

verses.text: 你們自己可以為我作證：我曾說，我不是基督，不過是奉差遣作他的先鋒的。

words.note: Lit. 'receive a sending'.

verses.text: 娶新娘的是新郎。新郎的好友站在那裡聽著，聽見新郎的聲音就非常喜樂。因此，我這喜樂滿溢了！

words.note: The '著' indicates ongoing action.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual joy.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual joy.

verses.text: 他必興旺，我必衰微。

words.note: Often used in spiritual or historical contexts of decline.

verses.text: 「那從天上來的，是在萬有之上；從地上來的，是屬於地，所講的也是屬於地。那從天上來的，是超越萬有之上。

words.note: Refers to the dwelling place of God.
Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Lit. 'ten thousand existences'; refers to all creation.
Classical particle, similar to modern '的'.
Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Refers to the dwelling place of God.
Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Lit. 'ten thousand existences'; refers to all creation.
Classical particle, similar to modern '的'.

verses.text: 他把所見所聞的見證出來，可是沒有人接受他的見證。

words.note: Marks the direct object, indicating it's acted upon.

words.definition: what one has seen and heard
words.note: A set phrase or idiom meaning one's experiences.
Directional complement, often indicating revelation or emergence.

verses.text: 那接受他的見證的，就確認 神是真的。

words.note: Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Forms an adjective phrase.

verses.text: 神所差來的那一位講 神的話，因為 神把聖靈無限地賜給他。

words.note: Used to form a noun phrase from a verb.
Forms a descriptive phrase or nominalizer.
Marks the direct object, indicating it's acted upon.
Connects an adjective to a verb to form an adverbial phrase.

verses.text: 父愛子，已經把萬有交在他手裡。

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Refers to Christ the Son.
Marks the direct object, indicating it's acted upon.
Lit. 'ten thousand existences'; refers to all creation.

words.definition: to hand over to, entrust to

words.note: Often forms a compound noun with a preceding noun, e.g., '手裡' (in hand).

verses.text: 信子的，有永生；不信從子的，必不得見永生， 神的震怒卻常在他身上。」

words.note: Refers to Jesus, the Son of God.
Forms a noun phrase 'one who believes the Son'.
A key theological concept.
Implies active submission, not just belief.
Refers to Jesus, the Son of God.
Forms a noun phrase 'one who does not believe and obey the Son'.
Often used with '見' (jiàn) to mean 'be unable to obtain/experience'.
Here means 'experience' or 'obtain'.
A key theological concept.
The raised space indicates the divine name, referring to the Christian God.
Often refers to divine judgment.
Indicates a contrast or turning point.
A common locative phrase meaning 'on one's body/person'.
